column4: ï»¿How do you get wireless cards to be recognized automatically on startup?
you make sure that you have a driver that knows the device and vendor ids of your device
I have it working, but I need to pull it out before booting, then push it back in later.  How would I know if it knew the vendor ID?
forget what I said. How about you just put the module (driver) into /etc/modules?
driver would get loaded. If device attached it should start working, if not attached nothing happens
I don't seem to have a /etc/modules directory...
it's a file. I have it in hardy. Are you using another ubuntu version?
you can put modules in it that you want to loaded on boot
ooh, I didn't realize it was a file.  So what line should I add to tell it to load my card?
what's the driver you use for your card?
lsmod could help to find the name
I use ndiswrapper if that helps, how would I check from lsmod?
that's it. Add a new line that says: ndiswrapper
I already have a line that says that.  :S
strange. What happens when you boot with the card connected, can you see the WLAN interface with iwconfig?
